title: Java Part 1: What's New
headline: Learn about the new features of Java SE 7 including new language enhancements with this free online Java Part 1 course.
description: This free online Java Part 1 course gives students an introduction to Java SE 7 by talking about some of the new features in this version of the Java programming language and what it can do that previous versions couldn't. These new features include new language enhancements as well as concurrency utilities, IO and New IO, file changes, and network protocols. Start this course today to learn about the new features of Java SE 7's development.

courseDescription:
This course, Java Part 1: What's New, will provide you with an understanding of Java SE 7, the new features included in the software, and how it compares to previous versions of Java. You will learn about the new language enhancements to Java SE 7. You will be able to explain the differences in generic type interface in Java SE 7 to previous versions of Java and how these are improvements. You will also learn about Concurrency Utilities in the latest version of Java like ThreadLocalRandom Class and the new Phaser Class.

This Java SE 7 course then explains the issues that came with the old IO of previous versions of Java and how the new IO improves on these issues. You will learn about how the new IO allows uses to interact with file data types. You will also learn about NIO Async Operations and NIO Async Channel Group.

This course then wraps up with Network Security Protocols. You will learn about the asynchronous channels of Java SE 7. By taking this course you will learn about the many upgrades that came with Java SE 7. So why wait? Start learning today.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Language Enhancements, students will receive an introduction to the latest version of Java. Students will learn about some of the past versions of Java and the newest features of Java SE7. This includes an overview of the many new language enhancements. The module will also compare the generic type interface from Java SE7 to past versions.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Concurrency Utilities, students will learn about New Concurrent Utilities that are a part of Java SE7. Students will also learn about ThreadLocalRandom Class, and how Java generates random numbers. The module will also go over the new Phaser Class and how it works to with its new phaser barrier.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, IO and New IO, students will learn about IO and New IO with Java SE7. Students will learn about IO on past versions of Java and how the New IO fixes a lot of past issues. The module will also go into detail on NIO File System Operations and how it can be used to move and manipulate files.
topics: Topic A: Java Stream Based File
Topic C: NIO File System Operations

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Files, Async, Change, students will learn about walking the Dir Tree with NIO. Students will also learn about Finding Files With NIO. The module will also talk about NIO Async Operations. It will also cover NIO Async Channel Group. Finally the module will cover NIO Change Notification.
topics: Topic A: NIO Walking the Dir Tree
Topic B: Finding Files With NIO
Topic D: NIO Async Channel Group

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Network Protocols, students will learn about the Network Protocols of Java SE 7. The module will cover the asynchronous channels of Java SE 7. The module will then cover the topic of Server Accept Client Msg. Students will then learn all about Sockets Direct Protocol.

modules.name: Module
topics: Java Part 1: What's New - Final Assessment
